result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Jackson-Bey Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Motion hearing at 01-21-2016 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial at 06-03-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant David Jackson-Bey in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion.  Atty Gumz states motion to sever charges.  
Atty Hendee objects to the motion and asks the court to deny the motion.  Atty Gumz makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion. The charges will be separate cases; Ct. 1 will be 15CM74A and Ct. 2 will be 15CM74B.
Reset Jury Trial
Set Motion Hearing
  Motion hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing at 12-16-2015 09:30 am
AFFIDAVIT IN SUPPORT OF MOTION TO SEVER
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO SEVER CHARGES

ADDRESS INFO for David Jackson-Bey Jr.
Current: 215 E ORMSBY ST, Oxford, WI 53952 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2015)
Prior: 1450 Country Club Court, Platteville, WI 53818 United States

Final pre-trial at 12-04-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 01-14-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant David Jackson-Bey in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is not resolved and there may be more possible charges.  Atty Gumz agrees and requests a trial date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date at 08-20-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant David Jackson-Bey in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Atty Gumz states that his client has brought up some questions and asks to withdraw the plea and this be reset.
BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the withdrawal of the plea.
Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

STATE'S
authorization for atty to appear
Return date at 08-05-2015 01:30 pm

with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 1 week from today

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
Atty Gumz files an authorization with the court.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Gumz asks for time for the defendant to appear for booking.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee does not object to giving the defendant 1 week to appear for booking.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 1 week from today  Return date scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
